reviewText: Wow - this is great! I didn't think I would like it and all of it this much. All three 20 minute workouts are really good. Advanced, challenging and varied. Despite the sweat this was so much fun. Also, the encouragement from the instructors is not just the ususal blabla, it's really helpful with information and sense. The emphasis on all of the workouts is to circuit train cardio & weights. I use this mostly for the cardio benefit, but I'm a weights junkie, so I love alternating the weights to keep it challenging. The third section is targeting the core with a mostly standing superfun routine that uses a weighted ball. He recommends 2 lbs or less, but I used 4 lbs and it was perfect. LOVE IT!!
summary: Didn't expect this to be excellent!

reviewText: I bought this for Jessica because I really like her workouts.  I have other DVD's of hers and just order another one and can't wait to get.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own a number of the Exercise TV DVDs because some of the trainers you can't find anywhere else.  This one has three different trainers, Cindy Whitmarsh, Jessica Smith and Michael Carson each workout about 20 min. each.Cindy Whitmarsh does Ultimate Fat Burn using weights and a mat.  I liked this well enough, she is a good instructor and cues well.Jessica Smith does Metabolism Boost, little mini segments of strength with cardio bursts in between.  I'm a big fan of Jessica Smith's, she has good cueing and her workouts tend to start out easy enough then she builds to harder and harder.Michael Carson does Fat Burning Cardio - my least favorite.  He uses the small ball, which I absolutely hate, you can use weights instead which I probably will do the next time this comes up in my rotation.  There was a lot of bending and twisting, I'm not a big fan.There are also 5 little mini bonus workouts, and when I say mini I mean mini.  No longer than 2 min, not worth the effort for me.I combine these little 20 min. workouts with other 20 min. workouts I have for a varied 40 min. workout which works well for me.
summary: Like two out of three, not bad
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an interval based exercise DVD. Satisfactory instructors lead good, solid workouts.  I prefer the "Metabolism Boost" for 20 minutes with the pleasant and likable, Jessica Smith.  Classic, but effective exercises, but I like watching her and am comfortable with her personality.  Jessica uses cardio bursts such as jumping jacks in between weight lifting. One can not miss the count down time clock in the upper corner!  For a killer total body workout, I love Michael Carson's "Fat Burning Cardio" for 20 minutes.  I alternate between a lightweight ball (aka, the playground ball) and a 3 lb. ball.  I love those torso twists he incorporates into the workout. I go on my own pace, because he is quite speedy. Either pace, your body will fully work. Happier with this more than the TOTAL BODY TONING, even though my fav, Stephanie Vittorino is not featured.
summary: Lots of options with your favorite instructors
Title: N/A

reviewText: This a great compilation of workouts!  I don't recommend this if you have knee problems - each workout is a bit tough on the knees.There are three workouts, each 20 minutes, plus 5 bonus workouts.Ultimate Fat Burn - Trainer Cindy Whitmarsh:  Full body resistance routine that works upper, lower body & core.  You'll need weights & a mat. This workout has similar exercises from Cindy's Results Fitness - 10 Days to a Better Body. It's an excellent workout.Metabolism Boost - Trainer Jessica Smith: Ten full body strength moves with alternating cardio bursts.  I love this one, she has a great push up move in this...intense =) This is the first workout I've done with Jessica as a trainer - she does an excellent job. This will get your heart rate up!Fat Burning Cardio - Trainer Michael Carson:  High energy routine!  Get ready to sweat. This is a full body workout, the moves focus a good bit on the waist and buns.  I was impressed with this one. Michael uses a light ball, however, you can use a weight 2 lbs. or less, or no weight at all - just interlace your fingers.The Bonus workouts:Firm Lower Body - Cindy W.  2:00 minArm Toner - Jessica S.  2:00 min.Fast Fat Burn - Jessica S.  2:41 min.Fat Burning - Michael C.  1:07 min.Trimmer Core - Michael C.  1:38 min.Great Pick me ups or to do in addition to a twenty minute workout!  Definately a keeper..Highly recommend to intermediate and up.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: I ordered a six-pack series of the Exercise Tv Presents Ulitimate Body.This particular DVD, Slim Down Fast, was one of my two favorites.Slim Down Fast is a compilation of 3- 20 minute programs offered on Exercise TV, put together for you.  There is also a 10 minute bonus workout.The first program "Ultimate Fat Burn" is instructed by Cindy Whitmarsh.  I have a few of her other DVD's and she's always a precise, inspiring instructor.  This is a full body workout using dumbells and a mat.  If you have knee issues...be careful..lots of lunges and squats.The second program is Metabolism Boost.  Jessica Smith is the instructor and she also uses dumbells and mat for a full-body workout combining strenth and cardio like the program mentioned above. I found this workout to be less intense than Cindy's.The last program instructed by Michael Carson really got my heart rate up! He uses a small ball (weighing less that 3 pounds) to add resistance to lot of plyo-jumps, sports drills, lunges, ab work, etc...The bonus workouts are 5 (2) minute exercises focusing on the lower body, arms, glutes, abs, and all over burn.I had originally rated this 4 1/2 starts, but am bumping it up to 5.  The warm-ups of the segments that follow are easy enough to intensify, so that I was able to keep my heartrate up in between segments, which was my gripe.  (I think I mixed this up with the "Star Cardio" DVD that Exercise TV puts out.  This is one of my favorite intense cardio DVDs. I give this DVD 5 stars for the content, adjustable time for workouts, instuction, and intensity.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed this video at first but it got boring pretty quickly.I picked this one because I LOVE Cindy's Results Fitness DVD and I wanted to try out Jessica.  Cindy was ok, but not nearly as good as in her Results video.  There were a lot of the same moves:  lunges forward, back, and sideways.  The cardio moves were ok but nothin special, but there was a lot of variety:  plyo lunges, cross-country skiing, quick feet/football shuffle, etc.Jessica's segment is good.  Her intervals are shorter, a minute or less a piece, and also alternate between strength and cardio.  Her cardio intervals are lower impact, such as jogging in place, jumping jacks, and butt kicks.Whenever I do this DVD I do these two workouts back-to-back.  I haven't tried the third segment.  I watched the shorter sections for ideas for new moves.  Cindy's workout has a ridiculously short stretch at the end (like 30 seconds).  This actually works very well for me; I just do freestyle cardio waiting for Jessica's to load.  However if you were going to any of these as a stand-alone you would want to follow up with a longer stretch session.
summary: Just ok but good for the price
Title: N/A
